intro: Silene clandestina var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, this species thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare plant in its native range.
